bill.title: An act relating to miscellaneous economic development provisions
bill.description: An act relating to miscellaneous economic development provisions

referrals.name: Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs

history.action: Committee Bill read first time
Referred to Committee on Ways & Means per Rule 35(a)
Referred to Committee on Appropriations per Rule 35(a)
Read Second Time
Rep. Botzow of Pownal spoke for the committee on Commerce & Economic Development
Rep. Keenan of St. Albans City, recommended for the committee on Appropriations
Report of Committee on Appropriations agreed to.
Rep. Ancel of Calais, recommended for the committee on Ways & Means
Rep. Ancel of Calais moved to amend the report of the committee on Ways & Means
Which was agreed to
Report of Committee on Ways & Means as amended agreed to
Rep. Browning of Arlington moved to amend the bill
Which was agreed to
Rep. O'Sullivan of Burlington moved to amend the bill
Which was agreed to
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 68 of 134 to Pass -- Yeas = 134, Nays = 0
Third Reading Ordered
Rep. Davis of Washington and Browning of Arlington moved to amend the bill
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 69 of 137 to Pass -- Yeas = 14, Nays = 123
Which was disagreed to
Rep. Masland of Thetford moved to amend the bill
Which was agreed to
Rep. Carr of Brandon moved to amend the bill
Which was agreed to
Read Third time and Passed
Read 1st time & referred to Committee on Rules
Referred to Committee on Economic Development, Housing & General Affairs per Temporary Senate Rule 44A
Entered on Notice Calendar
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Economic Development, Housing & General Affairs
Referred to Committee on Finance per Senate Rule 31
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Mullin

Rules suspended & bill committed to Committee on Appropriations with the report of Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs and Committee on Finance intact, on motion of Senator Mullin
Entered on Notice Calendar
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Finance
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Appropriations
New Business/Second Reading
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Finance
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Appropriations
Read 2nd time, reported favorably with proposal of amendment by Senator Mullin for Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs
Reported favorably by Senator Sirotkin for Committee on Finance with proposal of amendment
Reported favorably by Senator Starr for Committee on Appropriations with proposal of amendment
Proposal of amendment by Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs amended as recommended by Committee on Finance
Proposal of amendment by Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs amended as recommended by Committee on Appropriations
Proposal of amendment  by Committee on Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs, as amended, agreed to
New Business/Third Reading
Read 3rd time & passed in concurrence with proposal of amendment
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Campbell
Senate message passed in Concurrence with proposal of amendment
Rep. Turner of Milton moved to suspend rules and take up bill for immediate consideration
Which was agreed to
Senate Proposal of Amendment not concurred in and Committee of Conference requested upon motion of Rep. Botzow of Pownal
Speaker appointed Botzow of Pownal, Marcotte of Coventry and Ancel of Calais as members of the Committee of Conference on the part of the House
Rules suspended and bill messaged forthwith to the Senate as moved by Rep. Savage of Swanton
House message House refused to concur in Senate proposal of amendment & requested Conference Committee; House Conference Committee members appointed
Committee of Conference appointed: Senators Mullin, Baruth, and Balint
Rep. Savage of Swanton moved to suspend rules and take up bill for immediate consideration
Which was agreed to
Committee of Conference report agreed to (House bill)
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Campbell
Rules suspended and bill messaged forthwith to the Senate as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
Committee of Conference report submitted by Senator Mullin for Committee, text
Committee of Conference report adopted
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Campbell
House message House adopted Conference Committee report
Delivered to the Governor on 6/1/16
Signed by Governor on 6/2/16
